oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eddie Rabbitt interview - Biff Collie Happy Hour - 1982-11-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Eddie Rabbitt (songwriter/performer), conducted by Biff Collie for his radio program Happy Hour on November 24, 1982.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Eddie Rabbitt -- Eddie Rabbitt talks about his last name being a real Irish name, with Gaelic origins -- Rabbitt talks about building a make shift ash tray in a chair in his families house as a child -- Rabbitt talks about getting whoopings as a child then his father would feel bad, and give him a quarter for ice cream -- Rabbitt talks about transitioning from a songwriter to a recording artist -- Rabbitt talks about it being more important to be a good songwriter than to be a good singer -- Rabbitt talks about what got him interested in recording -- Rabbitt talks about getting his first songwriting contract -- Rabbitt talks about the joy of being able to make a living doing what you love -- Rabbitt thanks Biff
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Rabbitt, Eddie, 1941-1998; Collie, Biff;
